intro: Chrysanthemum matricariodes, commonly known as the ragged chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are usually lobed and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Chrysanthemum matricariodes is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soils.
